page.title: 20SOMERSET DIALECT, HIGH HAM
page.content: Many families have lived in the area for generations and continue to use the{Somerset dialect}today. It is still very much in use by children and adults alike. Some words frequently heard are:- {anyroad}= anyway {barton}= farmyard {bide}= stay {caddle}= fuss,worry {chimley}= chimney {diddikies}= gypsies {dimpsey}= twilight{the electric}= electricity {girt}= big {glutchy}= swallow {gramfies}=woodlice {heaving}= retching {mind}= remember {muther}= slimy jelly in cider {panky}= breathe hard {peek}= hay fork {smeech}= smoke {spurdle}= spread {stabber}= upright stick in hedge to keep laid rods in place {suant}= smooth {withy wind}= bindweed {wivver}= sound of wind {where's he to?}= where is it?
